title: Welcome
text:
Welcome
Hello! This is my simple personal website.



My name is Henry Kombol and I am an Applied Economics Master’s Student at the University of Minnesota. I started my academic journey at Loyola Marymount University in Los Angeles, California, obtaining a B.S. in Economics in 2022. Upon graduation, I became the inagural Pre-Doctoral Fellow at the Center for the Study of Los Angeles. StudyLA advocates for a better more equitable Los Angeles through research, student mentorship, and engagement with residents and leaders. After two years at StudyLA, I moved to Minneapolis Minnesota and worked at the Animal Humane Society as a Advancement Data Analyst before I started at the University of Minnesota in Fall 2025. My research interests revolve around Developmental and Environmental Economics. I have experience in R, Stata, Python, SAS, and Excel.

title: Contact Information
text:
Contact Information

title: Projects
text:
Police and Community Relations Survey (2023) - A multi-year study aimed at capturing the on issues of policing in Los Angeles
Sharing P.O.W.E.R. (2022) - A report that was commissioned by the Office of Mayor Eric Garcetti to provide a data-based analysis of representation (by sex and race/ethnicity) in mayoral appointees in the City of Los Angeles.



Research on Covid-19: An Economic Analysis (2021) - A final paper for my Math for Economics Course. In this paper, I investigated the Covid-19 vaccination rates in developing countries compared to more developed countries.
How the Three Point Line Revolutionized Basketball - A research paper investigating how the three point line’s introduction revolutionized the game of basketball using historical NBA datasets.
